snippet: The longtime Reds shortstop was the only player elected by baseball writers, and will join Ron Santo, who was elected posthumously last month by the veterans committee.
abstract: Barry Larkin, longtime Cincinnati Red shortstop, is the only player from 2012 class elected into Baseball Hall of Fame; he joins Ron Santo, who was elected posthumously in December 2011 by the veterans committee.
lead_paragraph: The longtime Reds shortstop was the only player elected by baseball writers, and will join Ron Santo, who was elected posthumously last month by the veterans committee.

headline.seo: Barry Larkin Elected to Baseball Hall of Fame
headline.main: Larkin Elected to Baseball Hall of Fame
headline.print_headline: After a Lucky Turn From Football, Larkin Lands in the Hall of Fame
